DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Hepatitis C Virus And Hepatitis B Virus Core Antigen Measurement Negative Test Result Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether the patient is HCV negative (by qPCR) and HBcAb negative (no prior Hepatitis B infection).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Hepatitis C Virus And Hepatitis B Virus Core Antibody Measurement Negative Test Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._A small, enveloped, positive sense single strand RNA virus in the family Flaviviridae. The genome consists of a single RNA molecule with a single open reading frame._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The determination of the amount of Hepatitis B virus core antibody present in a sample._A test result that indicates that a specific disease, condition, or attribute being assessed is not present.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the patient HCV negative (
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient HCV negative (by qPCR) and HBcAb negative (no prior Hepatitis B infection)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC Question
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of any chronic hepatitis as evidenced by the following: positive test for hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg), positive test for qualitative hepatitis C viral load (by PCR) (Note: Subjects with positive hepatitis C antibody and negative quantitative hepatitis C by PCR are eligible. History of resolved hepatitis A virus infection is not an exclusion criterion.), history of alcoholic or non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH), auto-immune hepatitis, or previous grade 3-4 drug-related hepatitis, or any form of chronic-liver disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the polymerase chain reaction (PCR) negative for HCV RNA

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a negative Hepatitis B surface antigen [HBsAg]?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the polymerase chain reaction (PCR) negative for HCV RNA, per local guidelines?
